programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May take a look at increasingly popular tall hatchbacks known as crossovers. Having concluded their primary appeal is to caravanners, the duo spend a couple of days in models by Mazda and Volkswagen and try to get a feel for what life is like for the people they believe would buy one. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond drives a pair of exciting Lamborghinis in Italy - the ferocious Aventador Roadster and the limited-edition Sesto Elemento, which carries an eye-watering price tag of around 2million. Two cars are also put through their paces on the test track, with James in a modern re-creation of the classic Porsche 911 and Aerosmith frontman Steven Tyler in the rather less exotic Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear

James May goes for a countryside adventure in the New Routemaster London bus brought into use in 2013, which is propelled by a turbodiesel generator and a powerful electric motor. Inspired by the machines they have tested, the trio then meet to celebrate Britain's motor industry with a grand finale in front of Buckingham Palace. Plus, former Formula One driver Mark Webber takes to the track for a lap in the Reasonably Priced Car.

Along the way, he stays in a village belonging to the Dani tribe and ventures into some previously unexplored caves.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson takes a four-day trek along the coastline between Plymouth in Devon and Falmouth, learning about the thriving smuggling trade in Cornwall during the late 18th century. The area's tiny secretive harbours, beaches and secluded coves were ideal for illicit imports such as tobacco and brandy, and the business was so huge it threatened the national economy. Along his route, visiting such beauty spots as Lantic Bay and Polperro, he encounters all sorts of reminders of the trade and meets descendants of those involved.

programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson explores the history of the ancient kingdom on a walk from Melrose in the Scottish Borders to Holy Island off the coast of Northumberland. Over five days, he goes on the trail of one of Northumbria's greatest sons - Saint Cuthbert. Through the Tweed Valley and across the Cheviot Hills, it's a journey through a murky history laden with myth. However, by investigating the communities, power bases and landscape of seventh-century Northumbria, Tony aims to understand the pagan land in which Cuthbert spread his simple brand of Celtic Christianity.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Rion-Antirion Bridge, which runs for 3kms and links the town of Rio on the Peloponnese peninsula to Antirrio on mainland Greece. Located in one of Europe's most active seismic zones, its engineers had to conquer the problems of deep water, high winds and constant land mass movement to build the colossal structure.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two

programme.title: Impossible Engineering

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Shakespeare - The Legacy with John Nettles
programme.desc: The actor examines the life of the Bard, investigating key moments and trying to discover what may have happened in a seven-year gap where he disappears from historical records.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Dag Bromberg: A City in the Forest
programme.desc: As the Red Army approached a forest in Poland toward the end of the war, they stumbled upon a massive complex containing more than a thousand structures across 25sqkm.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: Using the latest technology, divers explore the remains of the troop-carrier SS Leopoldville. The ship was torpedoed in the English Channel on Christmas Eve 1944, resulting in the deaths of almost 800 American soldiers. Narrated by Russell Boulter.

programme.title: Deep Wreck Mysteries
programme.desc: The search for traces of British warship HMS Curacoa, which collided with the Queen Mary and sank 50 miles off the Irish coast in 1942. The vessel was escorting the liner, which was carrying 20,000 American troops, to the Clyde when the accident occurred, though a news blackout subsequently obscured details of the incident.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, goes behind closed doors to reveal the private lives of six historical figures, beginning with Princess Margaret. Dr Borman discovers the real reason Margaret's relationship with RAF officer Peter Townsend came to an end, uncovers her disastrous marriage to Antony Snowden and discovers more about her love of music and devotion to duty.

programme.title: Private Lives
programme.desc: Dr Tracy Borman, Chief Curator at Historic Royal Palaces, explores Edward VIII's childhood with his overbearing father, reveals how the First World War saw him grow up in more ways than one, and explores his apparent desire for married women. She also uncovers the truth about Edward's abdication of the throne, and Wallis Simpson's infidelity, and reveals how Edward was a fashion icon of the day, examining his clothes in Kensington Palace.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and his team are venturing into the heart of Suriname, to kayak an unnamed river that will take the them through a forest unchanged for millions of years.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and the team battle through the jungle into the heart of Indonesian Borneo. Here, a remote mountain range guards caves, holding secrets that could rewrite the history of man.

programme.title: Fleetwood Mac - Don't Stop
programme.desc: Documentary looking back over the band's long career, from the early blues outfit led by Peter Green in the late 1960s, to their reincarnation in the 1970s with the line-up that went on to record the 40-million-selling album Rumours. Mick Fleetwood, John McVie, Lindsey Buckingham and Stevie Nicks reveal the truth behind the successes, failures and relationships that characterised their music and made them one of the most enduring acts in popular music.

programme.title: Meat Loaf: In and Out of Hell
programme.desc: A profile of the rock star's life and career, reflecting on the music that propelled him to fame and charting his journey from an overweight, bullied child to his larger-than-life persona and icon status. Featuring an interview and performance by the singer, as well as backstage footage from a Las Vegas concert. The film also revisits the Dallas of Meat Loaf's early years and includes insights from high school friends who reveal where the unusual moniker really came from.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: An unprecedented insight into the Royals and the armed services that fight in their name, from the early 20th century to modern-day conflicts such as Afghanistan. The first episode focuses on Prince Philip and Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: Titanic: Stories from the Deep
programme.desc: Thanks to the use of cutting-edge technology, a unique collection of artefacts salvaged from the underwater resting site of the famous wreck suggest new stories of love, deception, fate and heroics. This first episode touches on Fifth Officer Harold Lowe. After Titanic sank, his lifeboat was one of the few to go back and pick up survivors. One of the people he saved, Renee Harris, gifted him a set of gold-plated nautical equipment as a symbol of her gratitude. Plus, a well-preserved alligator bag recovered from the wreck site containing fascinating clues about the life of its owner.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The Independent, a skyscraper in Austin, Texas. At a height of 690ft, it is the tallest building in the city, surpassing the 683ft Austonian, another residential skyscraper.

programme.desc: The history of the concentration camp, charting its origins as a place to hold political prisoners through its development into a mechanised factory for mass murder. programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at the early stages of genocide at the camp, examining the role of commander Rudolf Hoess in the process. Despite later claiming he was only following orders, Hoess was instrumental in the development of Auschwitz for mass murder, arranging for Soviet prisoners to be brought in as construction workers and scouring Europe for more victims to kill. Featuring contributions from survivors.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. programme.desc: A medal for bravery, a suicide pill and an unlikely hiding place all add up to a confusing time for reluctant resistance fighter Rene, who determines to flee to England with Yvette instead of the two British airmen Fairfax and Carstairs.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The construction of Kansai International Airport upon the largest man-made island in the world, in Osaka Bay, Japan. Pioneering innovators from the past such as Pierre Danel, who developed a system against the pounding sea, and 19th-century mechanic Richard Dudgeon made the project possible. The development of airports including Berlin's Tempelhof Airport and London's Croydon Airport are also explored to reveal how engineers attempted this feat of engineering..

programme.title: Nazi Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Some of the most shocking cases connected with the regime's bloody reign, beginning with the case of Hitler's niece Geli Raubal, who was found dead in his apartment in 1931.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris takes a railway trip across Canada, revealing how 2,500 miles of transcontinental railway was built against huge odds in just a few decades, helping to join together a vast wilderness of isolated communities and create the country that exists today. He begins his journey on one of the earliest sections of track to be built, on a train that is now a lifeline for hunters and fishermen. He then sees one of the biggest, most famous trains in the world - the Canadian, before heading for the Prairies, and on to the port of Vancouver. Along the way he also searches for Winnie the Pooh, crosses raging rivers and meets the descendant of a pioneering Yorkshire family who arrived here more than 100 years ago.

programme.desc: Lexie comes face to face with her estranged mother, and Archie finds himself caught in the middle of the cat fight. Meanwhile, Katrina is stunned to hear her school is scheduled for closure. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim finds himself embroiled in the glitzy world of cabaret when a lounge singer commits suicide, and he uncovers a possible link to forged banknotes discovered at a racetrack.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline wants Oswald to have a sperm count, and the family meets Jack at the airport when he returns from America. Victor McGuire stars.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin's plans for expansion cause chaos with the Yellowcoats when an old cottage is scheduled for demolition. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Sandy falls out with her boyfriend, and Alistair tries to woo the elusive Judith, giving Jean the perfect chance to leap in with her infallible romantic advice - while the more sceptical Lionel stays well out of the way.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Some Adventures of the Inventor of the Mother Stitch
programme.desc: Barry is shocked to discover his golf captain has moved in next door when Glenda shows a keen interest in her new neighbours. Hobbo tries to help a dejected Morton feel less lonely, while Hobbo's driving skills attract unwanted attention when he takes to the wheel of a truck following a visit to an inn.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: While presiding over a murder trial in which a lawyer is representing himself and his younger siblings, Deed rekindles his affair with the scheming Francesca Rochester, ignoring his pregnant daughter's pleas for help in the process. Blind to what's happening around him, and resisting warnings from Jo, the judge eventually realises his mistress has been deceiving him and must hope he has not left it too late to come to the aid of Charlie and her unborn child. High Court drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jenny Seagrove and Billie Whitelaw.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Ricky Hanson faces trial for attempted murder, and his lawyer sets about trying to discredit each member of the squad. However, Jack receives a welcome distraction when an old friend asks him to reinvestigate the death of a wealthy businessman, and he, Brian and Gerry spring into action. Guest starring David Troughton, with Amanda Redman, James Bolam, Alun Armstrong and Dennis Waterman.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Boyd is horrified to learn that Carl Mackenzie, the man accused of a shopping centre massacre, has been granted the right to appeal. Refusing to believe the wrong man was convicted, he throws himself into the case, but when the squad unearths new evidence that supports Mackenzie's claim, it also leads to the discovery of some disturbing truths about their superior officer. Trevor Eve stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Honey can't bring herself to contemplate the terrifying prospect that fiance Scott might have murdered his first wife, despite Yvonne and Steve's suspicions that there might be something to Greg's allegations. Lance tries to get the Cole Lane Estate's teenage population interested in cricket, hoping to bridge the generation gap and recruit informers at the same time, but his best efforts are jeopardised when Gary sets up a bungled drugs bust.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: After the threat of closure, the refurbished station reopens - and welcomes two fresh members of staff. Young Billy Rae's inexperience presents a problem, but the Blue Watch have more difficulties learning to trust fellow newcomer Geoff Pearce.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy remains in hospital, and his friends are told that he may never recover his sight, while Marsha Stubbs' involvement with a local businessman leads to a brush with the law.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The regiment's tour in Germany is cut short. Meanwhile, a prank in the Officer's Mess causes trouble for Tucker. Starring Robson Green and Rob Spendlove.

Mubbs asks Lisa to move in with him but she proves reluctant, and Diane advises Tricia to tell Chrissie the truth about Frank - not realising the full extent of her secrets.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: An accident in A&E persuades Adam to reveal his secret to Sam - an unlikely choice for a confidant given their recent inability to see eye-to-eye. Charlie tries to help a rape victim brought to his attention by her distraught husband - who is immediately viewed with suspicion by Tina.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PC Dan Casper arrives at Sun Hill, and immediately risks life and limb to rescue a girl attempting to kill herself on a dual carriageway. programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sam's new friend Clive pushes his luck and visits the Vic. Kathy takes positive action to deal with a recurring problem from the past. And the trial of Nick Cotton finally begins.

programme.desc: The Blue Watch team is called to a suspected arson attack on a run-down council estate. Later, a young boy is found handcuffed to a bench by a river.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Hector is so incensed by the sudden arrival of his pregnant daughter Lizzie that he decides to disown her. Meanwhile, Archie races to reconcile his feuding family, and Katrina faces a difficult decision. Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers and Susan Hampshire.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim bids a temporary farewell to the familiar surroundings of his beloved Jersey and ventures into the heart of London to investigate a kidnapping. Crime drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey feels he has to tell his mother he is in debt to the tune of 20,000, and the whole family are required to help him out.

programme.desc: The Yellowcoats fight to save Fred's horses from the glue factory - with unexpected results. Comedy, starring Felix Bowness.

programme.sub-title: The Mother of All Mistakes - Or Is It?
programme.desc: Hobbo discovers the whereabouts of his real mother and decides to pay her a visit, but is unimpressed by the welcome he receives. Marina chains herself to a supermarket trolley in protest against the unreliability of men, while Nelly reveals some information that greatly lifts Hobbo's spirits.

programme.desc: A forgetful clock-mender contacts the sleuth when he becomes the target of a couple of small-time crooks. Armed with advice from DCI Adams, Hetty starts her investigation at a video store and soon discovers that there is more to the case than meets the eye.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is called in to investigate when a convicted killer is cleared of the murder of his adoptive father on appeal. Drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Claire Goose.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim cuts short a holiday in France to guard a VIP threatened with assassination - but it turns out the dignitary does not want protection. Drama, starring John Nettles.

programme.desc: Jeffrey resolves to sort out his marital difficulties by agreeing to a divorce. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell.

programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The Lynleys are looking forward to becoming parents, but Helen succumbs to temptation and dabbles in her husband's latest case. Mickie is rejected for medical training and finds herself being manipulated by Donna, while patients' lives are put at risk as Michael is blackmailed by a face from the past.

programme.desc: Trouble brews for a band of environmental protestors faced with eviction, Max's son is admitted after overdosing on heroin and then causes a furore by discharging himself against George's advice. programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pete is stood up by Rose but then has a pleasant surprise. Aidan sleepwalks in the Square, and Ricky tries to to save his marriage but Sam leaves abruptly in a cab.

programme.desc: Ricky makes one last effort to save his marriage and Sam comes to a decision. Frank tries to help Pat face going to court. Rachel gets fed up with market life.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: George is aggrieved to learn his father has cancer, and Nick saves a boy's life, but hurts himself in the process. Meanwhile, Bayleaf finds himself up in front of the magistrate.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie believes he has a solution to the estate's crumbling finances - but his new bank manager arrives with plans of her own. Meanwhile, down at the local golf club, Hector's old-fashioned views about lady members provoke serious resistance. Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: While attending a fashion show as a guest of Danielle's cousin, Jim witnesses a shooting and see somebody running off. He decides to put his detective skills to use and investigates, desperate to find a missing link. John Nettles stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Aveline continues to believe in her phantom pregnancy, Billy discovers Julie has a new lover and Jack goes for a job as a handyman.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Joe Maplin commissions a statue of himself and issues strict instructions for the unveiling - paving the way for more chaos and confusion at the holiday camp. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell and Paul Shane.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel suffers embarrassment when he walks in on Sandy in the bath, and once the sniggers subside Jean decides to have a second bathroom installed and calls in the builders. As the tension increases, she realises a minor incident has been turned into a major issue that she can ill afford.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Looking Sideways at Nelly?
programme.desc: Hobbo enlists the help of Aunty Wainwright to become a master of disguise and deceive his secret enemies, and is delighted when Marina is attracted to his new looks - to the great annoyance of Howard. Meanwhile, a misunderstanding over a neck injury puts the police on Alvin and Entwistle's trail.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: Murdoch suspects murder at what first appears to be the double suicide of a wealthy high-society couple, who are found floating in their pool.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Dwayne is in high spirits after meeting a new woman on a night out, but his joy is cut short when she is found dead the following morning. It soon transpires the victim was living under a false identity and gathering evidence against a money-laundering ring, but as the team struggles to piece together the clues, Richard hears the news he has been longing for - his old job is available if he wants it. It looks like the Caribbean cops will be solving this murder without their British DI. John Thomson guest stars, with Ben Miller, Sara Martins, Danny John-Jules and Gary Carr.

programme.title: New Tricks

With guest appearances by Roger Lloyd Pack and George Costigan.

programme.title: Waking the Dead

Spencer complicates matters further by revealing he lived there with his family when the events must have taken place. Crime drama, starring Trevor Eve, Sue Johnston and Holly Aird.

programme.desc: Feature-length drama in which the Middle Ages' answer to Sherlock Holmes sets out to investigate a slave girl's disappearance and locate a treasured relic missing from his abbey. Unfortunately, no sooner has he begun searching for a connection than a dead body turns up on his doorstep, plunging him into a mire of murder and subterfuge. Starring Derek Jacobi, Terrence Hardiman, Anthony Green, George Irving and Louise Delamere.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish dealer's daughter Vicki finds a ceremonial sword in the attic of her new flat that proves to have Scottish connections dating back to the era of Bonnie Prince Charlie. Lovejoy is approached by a man offering a generous sum for it, claiming a family connection. Later, after the item is subjected to a bungled burglary attempt investigations reveal it may hold the key to the location of buried treasure. Ian McShane stars.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Sharpe
programme.desc: Maverick British rifleman Richard Sharpe is promoted for saving General Wellesley's life, and sent behind enemy lines to rally Spanish support. Surrounded by the French, he manages to pull off an inspiring propaganda coup in the small town of Torrecastro. Swashbuckling adventure, featuring Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes and starring Sean Bean and Brian Cox.

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: New plumber Harry joins the gang and promptly declares Oz to be the most important person he has ever encountered - a Falklands veteran who has been to Nashville and met Country star Merle Haggard. Jimmy Nail stars, with a guest appearance by Kevin Lloyd (The Bill).

programme.title: Auf Wiedersehen, Pet
programme.desc: Fraser calls off his goons and agrees to let the Magnificent Seven stay in the manor house rent-free, while Oz encounters a lady who is keen to make the most of his company. Morag Hood guest stars, with Jimmy Nail.

programme.title: Ms Fisher's Modern Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: When Graham King's wife Shirley is murdered in an explosion that almost claims Peregrine too, the investigation heats up and exposes a maze of fraudulent activity.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The sleuthing priest sets out to solve the murder of a local aeronautics magnate's son, and disaster strikes when Lady Felicia loses her singing voice. Robert Daws guest stars.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The clerical sleuth encounters a voodoo priest who is intent on winning back the woman he loves - no matter the cost. Fifties-set crime drama based on the stories by GK Chesterton, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.desc: The chairman of the Classic Car Restoration Society is found dead alongside his beloved El Dorado with a lungful of gasoline. The investigators try to determine whether his fate was due to a petrol siphoning accident or something more deliberate. They also wonder whether it was linked to an unidentified dead body found in his garage the day before. Neill Rea and Fern Sutherland star.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: When Brackenreid leaves Toronto to help an old friend find a missing woman, he learns he's a lot closer to the case than he thought.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam and the rest of the CID unit get to work in an effort to prove Gene's innocence when he becomes a suspect in a murder case. But as the investigation continues, further evidence is stacked up against Hunt, leading to a conclusion that rocks the very foundations of the detective's already fragile world. John Simm and Philip Glenister star.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam questions the ethics behind the team's methods when their attempts to catch a murderer lead to some inevitable problems, but a private meeting with Morgan leads to revelations that turn the detective's world upside down - and offer him a chance to go home. Last-ever episode of the fantasy drama, starring John Simm and Philip Glenister.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The resourceful barrister defends an Army chaplain accused of murdering his brother. His efforts are not exactly helped by the client's refusal to speak - leaving him to wonder whether he is suffering from shell-shock brought on by a tour of Bosnia or whether he has something to hide. Starring John Thaw, with John Wood, Richard Pasco, Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.

programme.desc: Robert begins a career as a journalist and Geoffrey joins a gym to help Hetty solve a case for her hairdresser, whose errant husband has a lot to hide following an apparently random attack in a gents' toilet.

programme.desc: The sleuth goes to North Yorkshire to meet her long-lost cousin Kate, and ends up investigating a case of demonic visitations. Amiable Geoffrey joins her in an attempt to provide moral support - and is soon drawn into his own little mystery.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama based on the novel by Catherine Cookson, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston.

credits.actor: Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers while holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London - a case involving a cleric whose disappearance is seemingly linked to an Irish train robbery. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Caroline Blakiston and Joan Greenwood.

programme.title: The Casual Vacancy
programme.desc: Tensions rise in Pagford as the parish council election approaches and each side steps up its campaign, with the fate of Sweetlove House hanging in the balance. Meanwhile, Miles pines for a quiet life and promises Samantha that once the vote is over everything will calm down, but she doesn't believe him, and Howard's dark secret is revealed in the Ghost's final post. Krystal returns home to find Terri back to her old ways, Hope seems more fragile than ever and news of a tragedy leaves the whole community reeling.

programme.title: The Last Post
programme.desc: The NLF want to make a trade. Alison watches over Ed, feeling conflicted over their marriage. Yusra smuggles a coded message to Armstrong, and Joe goes against his orders.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: King Henry VII and Lizzie travel to Spain to secure their son's betrothal, but find news of their country's instability has preceded them. Meanwhile, unrest growing in Burgundy spills over into an English battle. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The daughter of a man held responsible for a fatal boating accident on the Thames comes forward with new evidence, claiming that a property developer sabotaged the vessel. The case means putting Strickland's wealthy sailing friends under the spotlight, much to the team's delight. Guest starring Barbara Flynn (Cranford).

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits one of the National Gardens Scheme participants, Clearbeck House in Lancashire, where beautiful sculptures blend with the flowers and wildlife.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Paddy Garvey is awarded his medal at Buckingham Palace, and an old flame returns into Major James McCudden's life. Starring Jerome Flynn.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a training exercise in dealing with chemical weapons, and the arrival of a new soldier in the regiment brings trouble.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Ramani is convinced someone at the station was responsible for the hoax call to her ex-boyfriend, but Roger is sceptical and begins to worry about her state of mind. Lance and Sheelagh's drugs investigation on the Cole Lane Estate takes an ugly turn when an elderly man is attacked and suspicion falls on two local dealers - one of whom is subsequently shot dead. Serial rapist Alan Kennedy is assaulted by a friend of his first victim and responds by making a chilling phone call to Samantha.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: The VRSA infection spreads rapidly around the hospital, and when Chrissie stumbles onto the source of the outbreak, Michael resorts to desperate measures, destroying hospital records and attempting to make her a scapegoat. Zubin leaves Paris's funeral to answer an emergency call, and Jess decides their relationship has no future if he keeps putting his job first. Devastated by her rejection, he decides to leave Holby for good.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A pregnant woman's life hangs in the balance as staff struggle to diagnose her condition. Two sisters squabble over their father's estate and a fisherman experiences bizarre hallucinations. Medical drama, starring Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Pat learns she is to appear at the Crown Court, while Sam goes back to live with her mum.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: The guilt over lying to his family about his affair with Mrs Hewitt takes its toll on Arthur, while Pete has to make a big decision about his relationship with Rose.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Kevin gets trapped in a shop that has collapsed under the weight of scaffolding. He calls Nick, who has already arrived at the scene and is trying to rescue people from the rubble.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Shocked at the waste in the Glenbogle house, from six-course breakfasts to separate rooms for the dogs, Stella embarks on a money-saving mission. As things start to fall apart and the staff picket the estate, Archie decides to back his friends, refusing to buckle under the new regime. Alexandra Gilbreath and Alastair Mackenzie star.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Charlie summons Jim back to Jersey to investigate the mysterious disappearance of a business associate's wife. Initial investigations reveal a lack of fidelity on the woman's part, that could involve colluding with one of Charlie's commercial rivals. Drama, starring John Nettles and Terence Alexander.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: The family dog is accused of biting a girl, Billy tries to make Julie jealous, and Jack gets a bumper wage packet.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Peggy's penfriend comes to stay, but some of the staff are not convinced his intentions are entirely honourable. Comedy, starring Su Pollard.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean falls out with Lionel, but the tense atmosphere between them does not prevent a visit from her sister-in-law Penny and husband Stephen. Bob Larbey's comedy about late-blossoming love, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Nobody Messes with Tony the Throat
programme.desc: Hobbo, Alvin and Entwistle set out to save the day when Howard suspects Pearl is seeing someone else and the trio soon draw up a surveillance operation that leads them to a seedy bikers' club. Toby sets out to find Aunty Wainwright when he has ironing problems.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Convicted murderer Charlie Walker seizes his chance to escape while in transit across the moors. The next morning a barmaid is discovered dead - leaving the duo to figure out whether she was killed by the fugitive. Tim Healy and Lynda Bellingham guest star.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team reopens a case originally worked on by a corrupt colleague of Sandra's father, leading the detective to seek the truth about her family's shady past - a decision that puts pressure on the relationship with her mother. Brian investigates a suspicious death at a brewery, while Gerry and Jack take the time to sample its wares.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.sub-title: In the Sight of the Lord: Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The Cold Case squad investigate a murder dating back to World War Two. In 1948, a former conscientious objector was found killed with a nine-inch nail driven into his head. New evidence suggests he may have been the victim of a state-sponsored execution, but the case becomes more complicated. Trevor Eve and Sue Johnston star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Mickey Webb, now working with the National Crime Squad, returns to Sun Hill and tells Jack he suspects Neil has ensured the silence of a key witness in a major money laundering trial. Alan Kennedy sets a trap for Samantha, luring her to a deserted warehouse and holding her at knifepoint, while Ramani's suspicions about Margaret grow after a witness statement goes missing.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Ellie and Hardy start to investigate Trish's life and talk to her ex-husband Ian, her best friend's partner Jim, and taxi driver Lucas - all of whom were in the area when the attack took place. The detectives need Trish to give her main video interview, which will be relied on in court if the case goes that far, but she is still traumatised. Hardy decides they should go ahead, but Trish brings the interview to a premature end when they ask her a question she is not prepared to answer. Crime drama, starring David Tennant and Olivia Colman.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Sesame Street star Elmo is in the studio to celebrate his new show Elmo's World.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: ITV Racing Live
programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present the opening day of the prestigious festival, including feature race the 3.30 Unibet Champion Hurdle Challenge Trophy, plus races at 1.30, 2.10, 2.50 and 4.10. With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary from Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. Saroop, Karen, Milo and Natalie work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Will is relieved when he tells Cain everything about Malone, Laurel is torn when Jai thinks they should move in together, and Victoria decides to get Harry christened.

programme.title: Dr Ranj: On Call
programme.desc: Dr Ranj Singh offers more advice on how to spot, treat and deal with some of the most common illnesses and accidents. As well as going over the latest medical news, he introduces viewers to some of the delicate young lives who are currently in the Paediatric Intensive Care Unit at the Evelina Children's Hospital. Plus, Kylie Pentelow goes to Moorfields Eye Hospital to find out about a breakthrough treatment for glaucoma.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a cleverly designed family garden that's full of fun for pre-school tots without being a primary-coloured plastic eyesore for the grownups who share it. Alan, David Domoney, Katie Rushworth and Frances Tophill also give tips on creating a mini-maze, creative sandpits and how to use plants to give an adventurous exotic flavour to play areas.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti - to explore, uncover and share the hidden gems they have to offer. Joanna kicks off her adventure in a Havana boxing gym with one of Cuba's rising female boxing stars. She visits the stars of the cabaret at the National Hotel that pre-dates the revolution, and entertains the cigar workers while they roll cigars in their factory. She visits the small town of Hershey, built on the success of the sugar industry, and visits the tomb of Che Guevara before heading off to Hemingway's favourite beach.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Current affairs show that tackles the issues behind the headlines from a Scottish perspective.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: Following a tougher than expected contest against Otto Wallin, Tyson's father John is critical of trainer Ben Davison, and Fury's team eventually part ways with the trainer as his rematch with Deontay Wilder is finally confirmed. Before the contract is signed for his fight with Wilder, the boxer also takes part in a lucrative WWE bout in Saudi Arabia against Braun Strowman.

programme.title: James Martin's French Adventure
programme.desc: The chef's culinary tour of France leads him to the diverse and distinct region of the Camargue, a natural region located south of Arles. James begins at Les Marquises, the Laurent family's farm, where he learns about the Camargue bull, and barbecues local fish for the family. Later, he visits a rice farm and cooks a risotto using his own rice-brewed beer.

programme.title: Party Political Broadcast
programme.desc: By the Scottish Liberal Democrats.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Cain faces up to Malone and soon realises he is not to be messed with, Vanessa feels it is time to tell everyone about her diagnosis. Samson is over the moon when Sam asks him to do an important job.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Ali assures Ryan that Gary, or someone hired by Windass, must have spiked his drink, and Alya confronts Geoff about her belief he is behind the nasty online reviews for Speed Daal. Aggie reveals that they've had several calls from newspapers wanting to get James's side of the story.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp goes on a camping trip to Brownsea Island with his family, where he plans to catch and cook dinner for the whole family. After taking his grandson fishing, he heads for a cookery masterclass with head chef of the nearby Rick Stein restaurant. The next day, Harry and his son, Jamie Redknapp, compete in a game of crazy golf.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: James lies to his Manager and Press Officer and assures them he is not gay, and Ali takes Maria on a terrifying car ride. Meanwhile, Nina wonders if Roy's ashamed to be seen with her after claiming the meeting with the bat group has been cancelled.

programme.title: The Trouble with Maggie Cole
programme.desc: Maggie wants to apologise to everyone she has upset, and decides to go and visit GP Carol Tomlin. The radio interview has gone viral and the village is left reeling from the revelations. Jill bonds with other fellow members of the 'outed six', Marcus and Roxanna. Meanwhile, Neil and Kelly embrace what was broadcast and pretend that they are lottery winners, and later, Maggie discovers the truth about Dr Carol's marriage. Starring Dawn French, Mark Heap, Chetna Pandya, Vicki Pepperdine and Emily Reid.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: The Home Game
programme.desc: A London couple get rid of walls to create an open-plan space that they hope will add value, a Cornish bathroom scrubs up with amazing results and a father splashes out on a bedroom extension for his daughter. Interior design expert Linda Barker monitors their progress and appraises the end results.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Samson finds a way to fund his trip, Laurel fights for her relationship with Jai, and Jamie is rattled by Andrea's custody intentions.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: A healthy gut can do more than help digestion. It is being linked to everything from obesity levels to mental health. Five years ago actress Catherine Tyldesley made a film for Tonight about diets. Now she is back to find out exactly what people need to know about keeping the digestive system in good working order.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Network Rail, which operates the country's railway tracks, focusing on Birmingham New Street station. Engineers battle the elements after extensive flooding, while beleaguered staff deal with stranded passengers demanding answers. Graffiti artist Banksy leaves Birmingham rail engineers a gift spray-painted on to one of the walls - all done under his usual veil of secrecy - and train manager Adam is faced with a passenger without a ticket.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Indian Pacific: Kalgoorlie to Sydney 'What Makes an Australian?'
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones continues his journey across Australia on the Indian Pacific. He visits Adelaide, Broken Hill and finally Sydney to discover the unique and diverse definitions of what makes this great nation.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Feeling the full force of DI Renton's investigation, Laura looks to those closest to her for support, but when suspicions fall on Ian, she is left questioning who she can trust. Seeking answers, she turns to a former ally, but the information she gleans only fuels her concerns. Meanwhile in the past, Oliver brings Andrew some devastating news, leading him to make a reckless and dangerous excursion. Jack and Harry Williams's thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Katherine Kelly and Sam Spruell.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: PhillipSchofield and Holly Willoughby host the grand final of the skating challenge. Joe Swash, Libby Clegg and Perri Kiely and their professional partners remain in the contest, and each pair is challenged to perform a special showcase routine choreographed by Christopher Dean and Jayne Torvill. After that one pair will be eliminated, with the other going on to the final round - performing their own take on Torvill and Dean's signature piece, Ravel's Bolero. And as if that were not enough, the entire cast of this year's show will return to the ice for one last performance.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: A healthy gut can do more than help digestion. It is being linked to everything from obesity levels to mental health. Five years ago actress Catherine Tyldesley made a film for Tonight about diets. Now she is back to find out exactly what people need to know about keeping the digestive system in good working order.

With analysis from AP McCoy and Ruby Walsh, reports from Alice Plunkett, Brian Gleeson, Luke Harvey and Mick Fitzgerald, betting news from Matt Chapman, social stable thoughts from Oli Bell and Chris Hughes, and commentary by Richard Hoiles.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Geoff tries to persuade Yasmeen that Alya is out to get him, while Gary convinces Maria that he did nothing to provoke Ali and that the guy is a maniac. Audrey worries that Ken is being railroaded into moving to Stillwaters against his will, and Imran puts pressure on Toyah to find a new job.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: A woman is murdered in a hedgerow but her son survives the attack, only to fall beneath the ice of a frozen pond as he makes his escape. DCI Vera Stanhope wades in and drags him out, and against all the odds he pulls through. As the investigation into the mother's killing unfolds, Vera finds a kindred spirit in the boy and comes to realise the key to solving the case lies deep in his memory. Detective drama, starring Brenda Blethyn, with Kerry Fox and Kieran O'Brien.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: McDonald & Dodds
programme.desc: The chalk-and-cheese detective duo are called to a private clinic where a wealthy patient has been killed. However, their investigation is made all the more difficult by the complex relationships of the victim's former fellow residents. Jason Watkins and Tala Gouveia take the lead roles in the second of two mystery dramas, with an all-star supporting cast including Caroline Catz, Hugh Dennis, Michele Dotrice, Freddie Fox, Suzanne Packer and Joanna Scanlan.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Thinking he's hunting down a rat in his attic, Magoo finds himself on the theme park, devoted to... the glory of Fizz..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo comes across Fizz encased in ice and thinks he has found a prehistoric man. He thaws him out and acts like a caveman, so as not to distress him..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo thinks he's helping out at an understaffed veterinary clinic. In fact, he's at the supermarket, where Fizz is trying to sell his cleaning products..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Miss Wince takes Mrs. Wicket off on holiday in her brand-new, swanky caravan; and Bean is left behind. But never one to let a setback knock his confidence, he decides to build his own caravan and sets off in search of the perfect 'quiet spot'. All would be well if he'd only not built the caravan out of Mrs. Wicket's garden she.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: Grandpa Max's engineer buddy Phil Billings gifts Team Tennyson the Omni-Copter, a state of the art flying vehicle.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis accidentally lures an unwelcomed guest into the hotel.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined by singer Jack Savoretti, who chats and performs. Chefs Richard Bertinet and Nisha Katona also drop by, along with pie-maker extraordinaire Calum Franklin.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up pastaball marinara - their take on meatballs in tomato sauce - baked banana French toast topped with berry compote, crispy chilli tofu and special fried rice, and peanut butter and jelly chocolate brownies. Their guest is chef Meriel Armitage, who prepares barbecue glazed jackfruit ribs.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team create a cleverly designed family garden that's full of fun for pre-school tots without being a primary-coloured plastic eyesore for the grownups who share it. Alan, David Domoney, Katie Rushworth and Frances Tophill also give tips on creating a mini-maze, creative sandpits and how to use plants to give an adventurous exotic flavour to play areas.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A masterpiece by landscape artist Henry Hogson causes a stir when it is auctioned for 400,000 after a fierce bidding war - and hours later, its former owner is tortured and killed. When a Hogson work is then stolen, Barnaby and Jones research the Midsomer painter with the help of art teacher Matilda Simms. They soon uncover evidence of forgery - but the killer is still at large. Guest starring David Bamber and Susannah Harker, with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.

programme.title: Goldfinger (1964)
programme.desc: James Bond is assigned to investigate a notorious German gold smuggler and discovers his quarry has ambitions much greater than first suspected. Pursuing the criminal mastermind around the world, Bond uncovers the villain's audacious scheme to destroy the global economy with a daring attack on Fort Knox. Spy adventure, starring Sean Connery, Gert Frobe and Honor Blackman.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: A special edition of the game show in which host Stephen Mulhern invites comedy pairings to take place. Inside No 9 stars Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith, Danny John-Jules and Robert Llewellyn of Red Dwarf fame and Nina Wadia and Lynda Baron, who co-star in Still Open All Hours, are the famous duos taking part. As usual they try to guess the popular phrases in the hope of scoring enough points to win a cash prize for their charity of choice - and making it through to the Super Catchphrase to play for 50,000

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Absolutely Fabulous star and travel presenter Joanna Lumley joins the boys as Star Guest Announcer, while Fleur East surprises another lucky viewer by turning up on their doorstep to offer them a Place on the Plane, ahead of the season-ending spectacular at Walt Disney World in Florida. Stephen Mulhern hosts a surprise stunt at a mystery location in London, and the Men in Brown continue on their intergalactic quest to find out which celebrity has The Squits. Plus, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the opening Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live Semi-Final. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for their place on their coach's team.

programme.title: American Gangster (2007)
programme.desc: The story of 1970s drug kingpin Frank Lucas, whose innovative methods of smuggling heroin into the US made him one of the leading figures in the New York underworld. A detective is assigned to bring Lucas's empire down, but his investigation is undermined by police corruption. Ridley Scott's fact-based crime drama, starring Denzel Washington, Russell Crowe, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Josh Brolin.

programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Hotel Transylvania
programme.desc: Mavis finds her childhood toy, Demented Debbie, in the attic.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott concludes his culinary tour of Antigua, picking up some of the island's famous black pineapples from a fruit and vegetable stall to make a lobster pina colada with rum, and visiting a hilltop cookery school, where he makes a rum butter cake. The Carribean tour concludes at the famous sunset party at Shirley Heights, where he prepares one last cocktail recipe.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up creamy seaside pie - their take on fish pie - and also prepare chilli and nachos, big burrito cake filled with sweet potatoes, smoky peppers and spicy rice, and finish off with their New York-style cheesecake topped with strawberries. Their guest is Rachel Ama, who cooks her harissa hotpot - aubergine cooked in a hot and spicy sauce.

programme.title: Griff's Great Australian Adventure
programme.sub-title: Indian Pacific: Kalgoorlie to Sydney 'What Makes an Australian?'
programme.desc: Comedian, actor and travel enthusiast Griff Rhys Jones continues his journey across Australia on the Indian Pacific. He visits Adelaide, Broken Hill and finally Sydney to discover the unique and diverse definitions of what makes this great nation.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the opening Knockout round, as 12 acts perform for a place in the live Semi-Final. Coaches Will.i.am, Sir Tom Jones, Olly Murs and Meghan Trainor all return to their infamous red chairs as the acts they have chosen from the blind auditions and the Battle Rounds fight for their place on their coach's team.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: Absolutely Fabulous star and travel presenter Joanna Lumley joins the boys as Star Guest Announcer, while Fleur East surprises another lucky viewer by turning up on their doorstep to offer them a Place on the Plane, ahead of the season-ending spectacular at Walt Disney World in Florida. Stephen Mulhern hosts a surprise stunt at a mystery location in London, and the Men in Brown continue on their intergalactic quest to find out which celebrity has The Squits. Plus, one lucky audience member plays to Win the Ads.

programme.title: Peter Pan (2003)
programme.desc: The adventures of the boy who never grows old, as he whisks Wendy Darling and her brothers away to the magical world of Neverland - where they come face to face with fearsome Captain Hook. Adaptation of JM Barrie's fantasy novel, starring Jeremy Sumpter, Rachel Hurd-Wood, Jason Isaacs and Lynn Redgrave.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking contestants James Jordan, Fiona Wade and Louis Walsh to 'see it and say it' as they try to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. After the first elimination, the two remaining players battle to reach the Super Catchphrase round, where one of them could win 50,000 for their chosen charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Nina Wadia, Linford Christie, Sarah Harding and Tyger Drew-Honey pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: The Good Karma Hospital
programme.desc: After months away with her family, Ruby returns to the hospital for her pregnant sister to give birth. However, when a life-or-death medical crisis unfolds, she is forced to decide where her loyalty lies. Meanwhile, Greg gets a surprise family visitor. Medical drama set in southern India, starring Amrita Acharia, Neil Morrissey and Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: Drama about the secrets and dishonour among the upper echelons of 19th-century London society, adapted by Julian Fellowes from his novel of the same name. The year is 1836 and the Trenchard family have recently ascended to the aristocratic society of London's Belgravia - only for a 26-year-old love affair to come back to haunt them and jeopardise the happiness of many. Starring Tamsin Greig, Philip Glenister and Harriet Walter.

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Hidden Caribbean: Havana to Haiti
programme.desc: Part one of two. The actress travels across two of the most enigmatic countries in the Caribbean - Cuba and Haiti - to explore, uncover and share the hidden gems they have to offer. Joanna kicks off her adventure in a Havana boxing gym with one of Cuba's rising female boxing stars. She visits the stars of the cabaret at the National Hotel that pre-dates the revolution, and entertains the cigar workers while they roll cigars in their factory. She visits the small town of Hershey, built on the success of the sugar industry, and visits the tomb of Che Guevara before heading off to Hemingway's favourite beach.

programme.title: Harry Redknapp's Sandbanks Summer
programme.desc: Harry Redknapp goes on a camping trip to Brownsea Island with his family, where he plans to catch and cook dinner for the whole family. After taking his grandson fishing, he heads for a cookery masterclass with head chef of the nearby Rick Stein restaurant. The next day, Harry and his son, Jamie Redknapp compete in a game of crazy golf.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Jill Douglas is joined by Gordon D'Arcy, Ugo Monye and Gareth Thomas to review the fifth round of fixtures, featuring France v Ireland at Stade de France and Wales v Scotland at Principality Stadium.

programme.title: You've Been Framed!
programme.desc: Harry Hill narrates a comical selection of mishaps filmed by viewers, featuring a fire extinguisher that explodes in a builder's face, a dog that looks like Andrew Lloyd Webber and a man who runs himself over with a tractor.

The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City

Siriol Jenkins narrates the documentary about the people who live and work in the city of St Davids in Pembrokeshire.

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Haunted by nightmares of Andrew and harassed by the journalists lurking outside her flat, Laura's world begins to turn in on her. When Winnie makes a surprising confession to her, together they follow a trail of evidence in the hope it will hold answers as to what is going through Carl's mind. But press interest and Katy's volatility threaten to derail Laura's progress. Will she learn what brought Carl and Andrew together, and the tumultuous consequences of that meeting? Thriller, starring Joanne Froggatt.

programme.title: The Station: Trouble on the Tracks
programme.desc: Documentary following the staff of Network Rail, which operates the country's railway tracks, focusing on Birmingham New Street station. Engineers battle the elements after extensive flooding, while beleaguered staff deal with stranded passengers demanding answers. Graffiti artist Banksy leaves Birmingham rail engineers a gift spray-painted on to one of the walls - all done under his usual veil of secrecy - and train manager Adam is faced with a passenger without a ticket.

programme.title: Broadchurch
programme.desc: Hardy and Ellie appeal to Trish to be more open with them as she may have information that - although not related to the attack - could help the investigation, but she is unwilling to co-operate. The officers of Broadchurch CID are slowly making their way through the painstaking process of interviewing witnesses and collecting statements and start to uncover inconsistencies and lies - and previously hidden connections between Trish and some suspects. Crime drama, with David Tennant, Olivia Colman and Julie Hesmondhalgh.
